revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, there's this thing on my skin that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. Also, it keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. And there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Plus, there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

Thank you for providing detailed information about your skin lesion. The changes you've described, such as the size and color changes, the presence of blood vessels, and the bleeding, can be concerning. Can you tell me if the lesion has been itchy or painful at all?
No, it's not really painful, but sometimes it’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
Thanks for letting me know. The itching and tingling sensations are important details. Now, do you have any family history of skin cancer, such as melanoma?
No, I don’t know of any skin cancer in my family.
Okay. Now, have you noticed any other similar spots or lesions anywhere else on your body?
There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
The new spots near the main one are important. Now, can you tell me about your sun exposure history? Have you had any significant sun exposure or sunburns, particularly during childhood?
I have had a lot of sun exposure over the years, but I can't remember any specific sunburns during childhood.

doctor_history.content: Well, there's this thing on my skin that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. Also, it keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. And there's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Plus, there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
